definition: Wen Yiduo (1899-1946), poet and patriotic fighter, executed by Guomindang in Kunming
surname Wen
to hear/news/well-known/famous/reputation/fame/to smell/to sniff at
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"

sentences.english: Wen Yiduo ever sang highly of Liu's creation.
sentences.chinese: 聞一多曾高度評價過他的詩歌創作。

sentences.english: A great scholar and poet, Wen Yiduo was brave in absorbing all exotic nutrition beneficial to his pursuit of poetic art.
sentences.chinese: 聞一多在詩藝追求中勇於汲納一切有益的外來營養。

sentences.english: The four directions causes that affect Wen Yiduo's politic chosen has been analysed in this text.
sentences.chinese: 本文分析了影響聞一多政治抉擇的四方面原因。

sentences.english: On Dance is one of the essays by Wen Yiduo in his typology of art.
sentences.chinese: 《說舞》是聞一多的藝術類型論系列論文中的一篇。

sentences.english: Can not write to it, put the poem Mr. Wen Yiduo song it adds.
sentences.chinese: 實在寫不出來，就把聞一多先生那首詩譜上曲吧。

sentences.english: The poem Miracle of Wenyiduo is a puzzle, difficult to be explained.
sentences.chinese: 聞一多的《奇蹟》一詩長期以來是一個難以破解的謎。

sentences.english: His posthumous work was compiled by Zhu Ziqing as The Collection of Wen Yiduo(four volumes).
sentences.chinese: 遺著由朱自清編成《聞一多全集》四卷。

sentences.english: Winter also had become acquainted with a Chinese poet-scholar Wen Yi-to, in the United States for treatment of a lung ailment .
sentences.chinese: 溫德還結識了到美國來治肺病的中國詩人學者聞一多。

definition: Wang Guowei (1877-1927), noted scholar
Ye Shengtao (1894-1988), writer and editor, known esp. for children's books
Feng Youlan (1895-1990), distinguished Chinese philosopher
letter/also written 書札|书札
Yanjing or Yenching University, Christian university in Beijing founded in 1919
Concise History of the Chinese Novel by Lu Xun 鲁迅
pinyin: Zhong1 guo2 Xiao3 shuo1 Shi3 lu:e4

definition: Su Manshu (1884-1918), Chinese writer, journalist, Buddhist monk, participant in the revolutionary movement
Liu Xinwu (1942-), novelist
Xu Dishan (1893-1941), journalist, publisher and novelist
Kang Youwei (1858-1927), Confucian intellectual, educator and would-be reformer, main leader of the failed reform movement of 1898
well-rounded argument/general survey
Qian Zhongshu (1910-1998), literary academic and novelist, author of the 1947 novel Fortress Beseiged 圍城|围城
translator (of writings)
Wu Han (1909-1969), historian, author of biography of Zhu Yuanzhang 朱元璋, hounded to his death together with several members of his family during the cultural revolution
Joseph Needham (1900-1995), British biochemist and author of Science and Civilization in China
Zhang Shizhao (1881-1973), revolutionary journalist in Shanghai, then established writer
